page.title: 06Banwell Volunteer Fire Crew
page.content: There are ten men in the fire crew at Banwell, all volunteers. They are great friends and they are always joking and messing around. My dad is the chairman of the fire crew and is known as Wally Rice. My uncle is also in the crew. Mr.D.Colbourne, the secretary, is teaching me photography. I like the nickname of the Chief Fire Officer, Mr.C.Hornett, it's "Stinger". The fire crew managed to get a Fire Engine from Board Mills of Bristol which had closed down. It is a Land Rover well equipped with a pump able to pump over 160 gallons of water a minute. It also has lots of different sized branches to fit the hoses onto. There is also a ladder on board. The Fire Crew all paraded in the 1985 Armistice Day Parade and also attended the service in Banwell Parish Church.
